title: Aural set, Let me let you - rhythmic motive

content.question: A distinctive rhythmic motive is played by the bass and guitars under the text “invincible” and again under the text “your eyes.” What is the best transcription of that rhythmic motive?

choices.label: One measure of rhythms in bass clef. The time signature is four-four. The rhythms are two eighth notes, a quarter rest, two eighth notes, and a quarter rest.
One measure of rhythms in bass clef, time signature four-four. The rhythms are two eighth notes, a quarter rest, an eighth rest, two eighth notes, and an eighth rest.
One measure of rhythms in bass clef, time signature four-four. The rhythms are two eighth notes, quarter rest, eighth rest, eighth note, eighth rest, and eighth note.
One measure of rhythms in bass clef, time signature four-four. The rhythms are two eighth notes, two quarter rests, and two eighth notes.

content.answer: One measure of rhythms in bass clef, time signature four-four. The rhythms are two eighth notes, two quarter rests, and two eighth notes.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
